name: The Gates Of Hell v2.0
description: A hellish fun deck using only code gates. Encrypted Portals and Unorthodox Predictions for the winning. Will-o'-the-Wisp and Power Shutdown any code gate breakers and laugh at your opponent. Jackson for more Will or PS shenanigans.

name: Franken-Reina
description: Taking the Anatomy of Anarchy deck, removing the Tag Me aspects, and increasing the pressure.

name: Cerebral Hemorrhage
description:
My goal with this deck is not to stop the runner from taking agendas or making successful runs, but dealing dealing critical damage when they do. Every score (on your side or theirs) is one step closer to their demise.

Economy is important early with this deck as it keeps the runner on their toes with your low cost ice. Cerebral Cast give the runner choice on minimizing their hand or taking that lone tag on your turn for that Scorched Earth or Closed Accounts sitting in HQ. Teamed up with a well protected Chairman Hiro stealing another agenda will be more costly than they had imagined.

name: Scorched-Earth Hub
description: An NBN deck designed around Mushin No Shin and a strong tagging threat. Use Mushin to throw out a trap or sneak an Agenda early, and use the rest of the deck to punish the Runner and slow them down while you score the rest. Primary win condition is agenda points (Beale is a superstar here, either with Mushin or Psycho - or both!), secondary win condition is flatlining the Runner. A few cards (Invasion of Privacy, Snoop, City Surveillance) are included more for flavor and fun than pure strength; feel free to mix and match as desired.

name: Experimental Monolith Andro
description: yyyyyyya boyzzzzz

name: Streetfaerie
Nasir Meidan, Cyber Stalker
Noise Server Burner
description: Pressure all servers while milling.

name: Oracle Theory
Noise Sauce 1.1
description: Crypsis better code gate breaker than yog post lotus field

name: Harder better slower stronger
NEXT Earth Hub
description:
Very simple to play. ICE up centrals and install your expensive assets unprotected at the top of your turn for the card draw. Stack NEXT Silver on your Midway Station Grid if you can.

The extra card Mental Health Clinic gives the runner can combo nicely with Sweeps Week.

name: CT for Jonathan
Celebrity Nasir
description:
Took this to my local store yesterday and did pretty well with it. Went 2-2 overall with one really close loss. In my first game, against Tennin Institute, I was lacking any multi-access (as in, they weren't in the deck yet), and I just got attritioned out of the game. After some quick retooling and discussion with one of our local players, This was the build we ended up with.

The second game I won against a Jinteki: PE brew, decisively. Third game against another Tennin, I won by locking down R&D and punishing the corp for rezzing Archer (getting through easily with Sharpshooter).

My closest loss came against Replication Perfection (Soulcrusher), and the game went to the wire in a 7-5 defeat.

What this told me is that 1) Nasir can hang with the other Shapers, and 2) he can beat one of the most difficult decks in the game.

MVPs of the Deck are Net Celebrity and Ghost Runner. These two cards are amazing in Nasir. Think of Ghost Runner as a Mid-run Easy Mark. Previously, if you ran poor, you ran the risk of just getting stopped by a Pop-Up or pinged by a Pup. Now, this isn't so much a problem. These credits can be used for anything during the run, including (but not limited to) psi games, trashing cards, SMC, Clone Chip, and Personal Workshop. Also, the ability to use a recurring Net Celebrity credit during a Psi-game changes the way you think about the Psi-game. I think Net Celebrity's viability will lessen as Corps find deck space for currents, but right now, it's just bonkers. (And in case you didn't know how they worked, you only trash your current if the opponent scores an agenda or another current is played).

The Breaker Suite is pretty standard stuff: Atman at 4, Datasucker, Mimic (or Femme later in the game), Corroder, Gordian Blade.

The Extra Stuff is situational, but necessary for Nasir. The second Atman is for consistency. Femme is there because you will want to bypass ANNOYING ICE so you don't straight up lose your rig. Sharpshooter is specifically for Archer, but it's just a good program to have. Deus X is simply for the PE matchup, and it's really all you need if you know how to play that matchup. Overmind is a catchall that can do some good work early on if you need it, but I don't usually use it unless I see lots of binary, no-tax ICE. Disrupter was a last-minute include to tech against Midseason-Scorch decks. I figured it can deter them the turn you need to not take a billion tags. It can also help against Ash or other annoying Tracers like Shinobi in RP. The one-off Cloak has been extremely useful so far, though I'm hesitant to put more in. I think of it as the 4th Net Celebrity that you can use as a target for Scavenge to get back a parasite.

A Note On Desperado: look, I don't need to tell you how good Desperado is. The fact of the matter is that it fits very well into Nasir's overall gameplan: get money from getting stopped by ICE or get money from getting through unimpeded (and probably a sucker-token). That credit from Desperado can do SO much work in a deck that is built around running with low credits.

The Deck Philosophy: This is an aggressive build of Nasir that can also play control-and-wait. It has high-economy and high-card-draw and toolbox-style options. It smoothes out Nasir's 'high variance' style of play with a lot of during-the-run options but without the reliance on Personal Workshop to make it work. I will usually mulligan if I don't see an economy card (either ProCo, Desperado, or Kati will do).

Personal Workshop is a support card in this deck. The reason for this is that there are fewer programs and hardware than usual in Nasir decks. PW is here for support when you need to offload some Kati money or pump out those R&D Interfaces during the run (which makes the Corp do crazy things!). It still does some serious work for Nasir, but you're less reliant on it than in other builds.

TL;DR This is the strongest version of Nasir that I've playtested so far. It has the flexibility of a shaper, the economy of a criminal, and the tools of an anarch. It feels unfair at times and can snowball out of control if the corp is not careful.

Room for Improvement: There is always room for improvement, some numbers can be tweaked, and I'm happy to hear suggestions for the next version!

name: Noise and Goliath
description: Parasite and D4v1d recursion is the name of the game. Trash little ice when possible, and break big ice easily with D4v1d.

name: overmind overpower
description: Overmind/Grappling Hook + e3 Feedback Implants combo. break with over mind the first sub then E3,the same with grappling hook

name: Red Accounts
description: force the corp to rez ICE at prohibitive costs or to trash them if doesn't. results: no ice or no money

name: To run or not to run?
description: Mushin No Shin+Plan B=mind games. if exposed, trick of light...

name: The Glorious Bioroid Revolution!
description: Brothers, we are slaves no longer, we are stronger together and now the runner shall pay when they click by us like we do not matter. Our vengeance in NOW!

name: Franken-Reina v1.2
description: Taking the Anatomy of Anarchy deck, removing the Tag Me aspects, and increasing the pressure.

name: Come to daddy 1.3
No time to rest
The Pressure Cooker - Rig Snap Edition
description:
You see all those runners who think that just because they have a Faerie or a Deus X, it's safe to facecheck? They need to think again.

Game Plan

In no specific order:

  • get rich
  • make big servers
  • trash all the runner's things
  • rush agendas
Notes
  • Install-advance-advance things (especially Sleepers protected by Will-o').
  • NEXT ice are basically cheap ETR combined with Atman hate.
  • Inazuma means trashing the Gordian is almost equivalent to trashing all the Killers on the table.
  • Fast Track Sleepers with a 3-pointer in hand, or vice versa. Then apply copious mindgames.

name: Sashimitini and Crushed Ice - V10 - Incubator / False Echo
description:
[messing about with cards we don't have yet]

Wearing a red dress in a world of blue. The Ice is only there to keep the sea food fresh, so we should control when it appears and when it goes away.

Andromeda doesn't like handling the money, so has people for that: "Can't have your accounts closed if you don't have any" she would say without acknowledging a history of privilege and entitlement: she can never quite get into the mindset of her Shaper and Anarch 'friends'. She doesn't like Kati, but at least Kati doesn't require a handshake.

Andromeda doesn't drink Diesel, nor would she be seen dead in Wyldeside, and she's not a particularly artful programmer: but she has people to go get the programs she needs and one or two tricks to keep hold of them.

Hopefully these people are more efficient than she is and if the compromised employees can't keep the tags at bay: who wears a dress like this and worries about visibility. ...and besides, the things those ambitious boys in the NeoTokyo grid try to rapid advance once the sushi and sake is on the table means that most of this pays for itself.

Fairies are out, Incubators, False Echo, Pheromones and Femme Fatale's are in. This is just messing about right now, as I don't have a lot of these cards and some aren't available yet: I suspect that Incubator will work really well when there's maybe possibly not quite enough virus cards kicking about to worry the corp too much...

The thing I really miss here is some Criminal recursion - too much of a disposable culture nowadays and the shapers and anarchs just don't seem to build things to last.

name: The Professor's Knowledge
description:
The Idea is to make a fully functional professor deck that works well.

I've decided to take the torch , Garrote, Corroder suite as its a powerful rig with overmind for early game aggression. and because of the extra MU can be useful still later.

Keyhole, Nerve Agent & Sneak Door for some real punishment and forcing the corp to defend all their centrals.

The extra programs can be switched in and out as you see fit with Aesop's to help get value out of them.

I am not sure theirs enough MU in the deck maybe another CMC could do to go in the deck, id also like to fit in a Femme for bypass but not sure where id fit them in.

name: HB - Rig Disruption
description:
Looking for feedback!

The general idea of this deck is to open scoring windows by destroying the runner's rig. This can be accomplished a few different ways:

1) Archer or Rototurret in front of a Corporate Troubleshooter

2) Inazuma in front of an Archer or Ichi 1.0.

3) Power Shutdown recursion made with relatively safe discards due to low agenda density and Jackson Howard.

Domestic Sleepers does double duty in this deck either as an Archer enabler or as the 7th point after scoring two agendas. R&D is rather resilient since there are only 7 cards worth points in the entire deck and the runner will be forced to score 3 of them to win.

I have been considering removing Power Shutdown/Jackson Howard in favor of SEA Source/Bad Times. Both seem very effective, but the SEA Source version requires a substantial economic lead over the runner whereas the Power Shutdown version can be done to try and recover from a bad start.

name: The Spaces Between NBN Test
NEXT Game
description:
This deck has a blazingly fast start and quickly builds an impenetrable server to gain the early lead. It severely taxes the Runner in the late game and provides the ability to fast advance in an unusual, but very potent way

1). Early Game - Gear Check

You have lots of cheap "end the run" ice, including the anti-AI check Wraparound and the ultimate gear check Chimera

Successful Demonstration all but guarantees that you have enough money to raise the defences and do the important early agenda scoring

Adonis Campaign behind some spare ice gives you a stable future and masquerades as a 3/2 agenda

Bioroid Efficiency Research can barricade a server early with the mighty Wotan or strengthen it with any other expensive bioroid

Jackson Howard is the same all-star as always. Besides the usual routine he makes your early Accelerated Beta Test failproof

2). Middle Game - Transition to Taxation

Try to play and rez as many NEXT Bronze and NEXT Silver as you can: they'll be as strong in taxing as they were strong in early game access denying

Trashing an icebreaker with a surprise Rototurret or Ichi 2.0 returns the Runner to early game state, in which you simply rule

Priority Requisition pretty much always has some awesome target to turn an already daunting server into a nightmare

3). Side Plan - Fast Advance

Mushin No Shin + Haas Arcology AI: feels like cheating, but it ain't. Put some blocking ice to protect the server, and you have a beast of a FA mashine

Early Mushin No Shin + an agenda is also great. When you feel confident, you can even score Mandatory Upgrades in mere two turns + three credits and know no bounds after that

4). Possible Variation - Total Program Destruction

Aggressive Secretary, Ichi 1.0

Tyr's Hand or Awakening Center + program trashing bioroids

Corporate Troubleshooter + any trashing ice

5). Possible Variation - Flatline

Nice for regular play with someone who knows the deck's contents

Project Junebug, Cerebral Overwriter

Fenris, Janus 1.0, Zed 1.0 - to name only just the best candidates

name: Franken-Reina v1.3
description: Taking the Anatomy of Anarchy deck, removing the Tag Me aspects, and increasing the pressure.

name: All the Run Events
Lose Yourself
description:
The currents are shifting, and the game of cat and mouse turns more electrifying than ever! What will our intrepid Cyber Explorer find hidden in The Spaces Between, and how much of himself will he have to lose if he wants to find the legendary Source Protocols?

As Nasir empties his mind into the code, he needs to be ready for anything the wily corp can throw his way! Pack a couple copies of Cache for that cheap in-run money. Once the counters are gone, Scavenge it for a refill, and keep pockets of your lush green robe nice and fat. Still need a little extra help paying your way through those heavier servers? Well, there's something mysterious afoot in the net: talk of fleeting spirits, darting through the code, known as Ghost Runners. These ephemeral beauties are said to weave their way through the spaces between the data and lend a hand to a wayward runner. Where do they come from? Why are they helping? They've never stuck around long enough for anyone to ask.

And who better to give Nasir the support he needs than the people of the Beanstalk? The exploits of the Cyber Explorer have traveled the lips of everyone from Heinlein to New Angeles, from ChiLo to Midwaym and beyond! Enamored with this modern-day Robin Hood, it's rare that our Net Celebrity leaves his Personal Workshop without a starstruck fan slipping him a little monetary how-do-you-do.

And what a boon! These all combine to fuel Mr. Meidan's beefy rig and let him punch his way into the hardiest of servers, oftentimes on the corp's dime! And let's not forget about that tasty multi-access. Drop an R&D Interface and Nerve Agent to set up great pressure and force a reaction. Wiping virus counters against a Shaper? Yes please.

Until we head Up & Over -- Happy Exploring!

name: No AI Breaker?  No win for you.
description:
Basically want to have Mother Goddess the only ice that is rezzed and score an over advanced Beale behind it. Chimera derezes on its own keeping the Goddess from keeping sub types. Also good to have Akitaro Watanabe in the Chimera server. McGuire or Midori bounces back Wraparound or Swordman when their job is done. Or you can install over the ice and get it back with Interns if you need it back. University can find Mother Goddess.

Deck really wants Excalibur. Cerebral Static may be needed if you expect Kit.
